page.title: 05A LOCK ON THE THAMES
page.content:
Cleeve Lock was built in 1775 and is a great help to{transport}on the river Thames.There is a resident lock keeper with a small house next to his office.
He told us when the{water}is up in the lock it measures about 4 metres and when the{water}is down it measures about 1 metre.There is a weir to the east of the lock keeping the{water} flowing.
Fridays on the river are mostly "DOWN"days and the rest are usually "UP"days excluding Saturday and Sunday which can be both.This is all because of the{tourists}on the river with people taking river cruises on hired boats from the local areas.
